subject: Sales
title: The Cuban Missile Crisis
description: A quick, practical guide to The Cuban Missile Crisis.

hook.text: October 1962. Soviet missiles in Cuba. Two superpowers one wrong move from nuclear war.

buildup.text: Kennedy resisted generals pushing for airstrikes. He chose a naval blockade to buy time.

discovery.text: The breakthrough came through a secret backchannel. Both sides needed a way to retreat with dignity.

twist.text: Khrushchev sent two letters with different demands. Kennedy answered only the softer one.

climax.text: Missiles left Cuba. NATO missiles quietly left Turkey. Both leaders saved face and avoided war.

punchline.text: The best negotiation saves face for both sides.

quiz.question: How did Kennedy resolve the Cuban Missile Crisis diplomatically?
options: By answering only the softer of two letters
